Description: Pair of hoop-shaped earrings made from silver wire. They are open at one side; the pointed ends overlap slightly.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, grave 3120 Found on the ears of a female
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1930,0711.237), beads and shell (1930,0711.233), pair of ear-rings (1930,0711.235), torque (1930,0711.234). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 116, 129: pls.LXXIV, 3ab; LXXV, 17; Tomb register, pl.LXX; The British Museum, 'Jewellery through 7000 years' [exhibition catalogue] (London, 1976), no. 28b
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (650)
